hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Fade in Neutral-Stress Transition
hypothesis_content.statement: During a NEUTRAL regime with rising negative news flow, if BTC enters a period of extreme volatility compression (e.g., Bollinger Band Width 20,2 on 4H chart < 0.015) and then breaks downward, the initial break will be a false move (liquidity grab) more than 50% of the time, leading to a sharp reversal back into the prior range.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a transitioning market, low volatility breaks often trap directional traders. Market makers and sophisticated players sell into the initial panic to provide liquidity, anticipating a reversion to the mean as the break lacks sustained fundamental driver, only news-induced fear.
entry_conditions: Market Regime == NEUTRAL, but VIX term structure or crypto volatility indices show stress building
BTC 4H Bollinger Band Width (20,2) < 0.015 for 12+ consecutive 4H candles
Price breaks below the lower Bollinger Band on a 4H close
RSI(14) on 1H chart < 25 immediately after the break
Entry on a 1H candle close back *inside* the lower Bollinger Band

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to the midline (20 SMA) of the 4H Bollinger Bands
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new 4H low below the initial breakdown candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The downward break is sustained. Price fails to revert to the 20 SMA within 24 hours in >50% of cases, proving the compression was a coiling action for a genuine trend initiation, not a false break.
